page.title: 12NTH. KILWORTH'S AUTUMN FAYRE
page.content: The{Autumn Fayre}is held on the first Saturday in September. It has taken place for ten years now is is becoming a tradition. For the first eight years it was held on the school field,but it now takes place in Church St.. About twenty organisations in the village take part .Some run stalls selling things like cakes,ice cream,lemonade or "White elephants". Others run sideshows such as coconut shy,rifle range,bottle stall,treasure island or pony rides. Since taking to the street another dimension has been added by having a fancy dress theme. For 1985 this will be the "20's" look. The profits which the Fayre makes are divided equally between the participating groups.In 1984 the share was Â£60.
